properties.otherAdvice:
High volumes of holiday traffic are expected approaching and through Blackheath, Mount Victoria and Lithgow during peak holiday travel periods.

For details about known holiday traffic pinch points, see the NSW Holiday and Journey planning website and the pinch point journey planning tool.

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Highway

properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Buses replace trains between Lidcombe and Olympic Park on Saturday 10 and Sunday 11 January. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
United Cup Tennis at Ken Rosewall Arena at Sydney Olympic Park from Saturday 3 to Sunday 11 January. Day sessions start at 10.30am and night sessions from 5.30pm each day.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from each session, and while other events take place in the precinct.  

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

webLinks.linkText: International Test Match Australia v England

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Extra light rail services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
International Test Match: Australia v England from Sunday 4 to Thursday 8 January at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Start of play daily at 10:30am and end of play daily at approx. at 5.30pm

With a sold out crowd of 45,000 expected each day ticketholders are urged to catch public transport and leave the car at home to avoid traffic delays and the high demand for parking. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group and allow extra travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 6.30am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.  
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Road and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road.
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am to 7pm daily on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street, Lang Road, Moore Park Road and on Cleveland Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am to 7pm daily on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street, Lang Road, Moore Park Road and on Cleveland Street.  

From 6am to 7pm daily 

  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (southern side) 
  • Cleveland Street between Abercrombie Street and South Dowling Street (northern side) 
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides) 
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side) 
  • Lang Road between Anzac Parade and Errol Flynn Boulevard (northern side) 
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side) 

*Note: Albion Street, Fitzroy Street and Moore Park Road clearways in effect from 7am on Sunday 4 January
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Illawarra Hawks v Cairns Taipans at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 5.30pm, full time around 7.30pm.

  • Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the match .
  • Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.
  • Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.
  • Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and in Darling Harbour. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Attendees are encouraged to catch public transport.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Festival – Live On Hickson Road

properties.publicTransport: Buses will divert while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Festival – Live On Hickson Road: Efectos Especiales from 5pm to 10pm on Saturday 10 January in the Walsh Bay Arts Precinct.

With large crowds expected, the following changed traffic conditions will be in place on Hickson Rd to safely facilitate the event.

Road closures

  • From 1am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Pottinger St and Towns Pl (south/westbound)
  • From 6am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St (north/eastbound)

Special event clearway parking restrictions will

  • From 1am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Pottinger St and Towns Pl (southern side and centre island)
  • From 6am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St (northern side and centre island)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Motorists should expect traffic delays in the area while closures are in place. Follow the direction of traffic control, allow extra travel time and watch out for increased pedestrian activity in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
Traffic controllers will manage access at the following locations:

Pottinger Street at Windmill Street

  • For vehicles requiring access to Hickson Road northbound and George Street. This includes Pier One Sydney Harbour and Park Hyatt Sydney guests, business deliveries, and residential access.
  • All vehicles will exit via George Street southbound.

Wilson Parking - Bond One Car Park

  • Managed access during operating hours, from 6am to midnight on Saturday 10 January 2026.
arrangementElements.title: Managed Access

BBL: Sydney Thunder v Hobart Hurricanes at ENGIE Stadium. First ball at 7.15pm and end of play at 10.15pm (approx.).

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from the match.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details.

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the Christmas and New Year holiday period between 22 Dec and 26 Jan.

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access.

Walking trails may also be closed due to total fire bans and/or risks, so plan ahead. 

Roads or car parks may close within the Royal National Park when they reach capacity.

The following locations may be affected:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach car park
  • Bonnie Vale day use area
  • Garie Road between Sir Bertram Stevens Drive and Garie Beach car park
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will manage access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - Christmas & New Year holiday period

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Macarthur FC at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 7pm, finish around 8.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Field Day music festival at The Domain Sydney on New Year's Day from 12pm to 11pm.

With thousands of people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St.

Roads around The Domain Sydney will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event.

Motorists should avoid driving through the area or expect delays and detours, and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

Road closures

From 7pm until midnight approx.: Art Gallery Road will be closed to incoming traffic.

From 10pm until midnight approx.:

  • Art Gallery Road from Hospital Road to Mrs Macquarie Road
  • St Marys Rd from Prince Albert Road to Sir John Young Crescent
  • Prince Albert Road from Macquarie Street to Art Gallery Road
  • Hospital Road from Art Gallery Road to Shakespeare Place
  • Macquarie Street from Hunter Street to Prince Albert Road
  • St James Road from Elizabeth Street to Macquarie Street
  • College Street from Park Street to Prince Albert Road
  • Cathedral Street at St Marys Road

If you are catching rideshare or taxis, use the dedicated drop-off location on Hospital Road at Art Gallery Road. For pick-ups after the event head towards Elizabeth Street or Sir John Young Crescent.
